channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Turnout is High as France’s Snap Election Enters Its Final Hours
item.description: The vote will determine the composition of France’s National Assembly, and the future of President Emmanuel Macron’s second term.

item.title: Turnout is High as France’s Snap Election Enters Its Final Hours
item.description: The vote will determine the composition of France’s National Assembly, and the future of President Emmanuel Macron’s second term.

item.title: 6 foods that could be making you age faster
item.description: New research shows how your diet may also play a role in how well you age.

item.title: Jim Clyburn Is Right About What Democrats Should Do Next
item.description: To find a new nominee, Democrats need to hold a real contest.

item.title: In Rafah, We Saw Destruction and the Limits of Israel’s Gaza Strategy
item.description: Months after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu declared that “victory is within reach,” the Israeli military escorted journalists into parts of a devastated Gazan city.

item.title: Nvidia will win the race to a $4 trillion market cap—but the long-term big tech battle might be different, experts say
item.description: “I think, a year from now, we [will] have three $4 trillion market cap companies: Nvidia, Apple, Microsoft,” Wedbush tech analyst Dan Ives told Fortune.

item.title: What Happened to the Originalism of the Originalists?
item.description: In both Trump cases the liberal dissenters are more originalist than the conservative majority.

item.title: New Plan to Target Russia’s Oil Revenue Brings Debate in White House
item.description: Treasury officials want to impose penalties on tankers that help Russian oil evade sanctions. White House aides worry that risks making gasoline more expensive.

item.title: Florida farmers turn to an ancient tree from India as the state’s once-famous citrus industry dries up
item.description: “For the most part, the citrus industry has died in Florida.”

item.title: The Hyper-Focus on the Amyloid Hypothesis for Treating Alzheimer’s May Have Slowed Progress Toward a Cure
item.description: The hyper-focus on one theory for treatment has slowed progress.

item.title: Farage and Future of Britain’s Conservative Party
item.description: In the shadow of Labour’s landslide victory over the upended Conservatives, Nigel Farage’s small insurgent right-wing party, Reform U.K., is on a roll.

item.title: British fashion house Burberry is reportedly laying off hundreds of employees amid huge stock selloff
item.description: Employees were informed during a Zoom meeting in late June, with those affected told they were facing redundancy or having to reapply for their roles.

item.title: Jon Landau, Producer of ‘Titanic’ and ‘Avatar,’ Dies at 63
item.description: In a decades-long collaboration with the director James Cameron, he produced three of the highest-grossing films of all time.

item.title: ‘A Little Scary’: Ukraine Tries to Stay Neutral in U.S. Political Dogfight
item.description: With President Biden’s future unclear, Donald J. Trump’s support uncertain and a major NATO meeting looming, Ukrainian leaders are straining to keep their balance.

item.title: Alec Baldwin is about to go on trial in the death of ‘Rust’ cinematographer. Here are key things to know
item.description: Baldwin is charged with felony involuntary manslaughter. If a jury unanimously convicts him, he could get 18 months in prison.
